text: Sam Bobrick (July 24, 1932 â€“ October 11, 2019) was an American author, playwright, television writer, and lyricist. He was born in Chicago. Bobrick was known for creating the television series Saved by the Bell. He also worked on writing the screenplay for television shows like Gomer Pyle, U.S.M.C. and The Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour. Bobrick died on October 11, 2019 of a stroke in Northridge, California, aged 87.Sam Bobrick, 'Saved by the Bell' Creator, Dies at 87 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1932 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:American songwriters Category:American playwrights Category:American television writers Category:American novelists Category:Writers from Chicago
title: Sam Bobrick
